title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 February 2016 - XWiki
content:
<Dr\_Cain> has quit  
00:27 <iphar`> has quit  
00:27 <Dr\_Cain> has joined #xwiki  
00:31 <iphar`> has joined #xwiki  
00:40 <abusenius> has quit  
00:47 <vmassol> has quit  
04:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has joined #xwiki  
04:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Hello  
04:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> I am unable to install the generic installer version on my computer.  
04:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> i do not have a admin rights here.  
04:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> i do not have admin rights here.  
04:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> If you've used the zip file or generic Installer, go to the directory where you've installed XWiki (XWIKIHOME) and run start\_xwiki.bat in Windows or start\_xwiki.sh on Unix. To stop it, run the stop\_xwiki.bat script on Windows and stop\_xwiki.sh on Unix or Mac. On Mac you will need to use "Open with Terminal" or run this script from the Terminal.  Concerning the Generic Installer, you can use this command to launch the install  
04:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Once XWiki is started point your browser to http://localhost:8080/ and then go to the User's Guide to learn how to use XWiki.  
04:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> i have tried to follow above steps  
04:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> but i am still unable to install.  
04:42 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> please ping me when you are back.  
04:42 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Thanks in advance  
05:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:48 <lynxt\_> has joined #xwiki  
06:49 <tillo> has quit  
06:49 <lynxt> has quit  
06:49 <lynxt\_> is now known as <lynxt>  
06:49 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
07:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:32 <mflorea> has quit  
08:06 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <RalucaS> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <vmassol> Good morning. FYI I'm patching xwiki.org this morning to add support for cancellable events so that i can install version 1.2 of my antispam tools.  
09:15 <martinus\_\_> hi vmassol  
09:16 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, I see here http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+change+the+Session+timeout that the default session timeout is 30min. Is it 100% sure it is the only place where the session duration is set in xwiki 6.4.4 ?  
09:17 <vmassol> hi martinus\_\_  
09:17 <vmassol> AFAIK yes  
09:17 <vmassol> thisis a servlet thing and cannot be set programmatically AFAIK  
09:18 <vmassol> just googled and it's possible using a HttpSessionListener but I don't think we have that  
09:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <vmassol> hmm apparently you could also set it with: getRequest().getSession().setMaxInactiveInterval()  
09:20 <vmassol> just grepped and we don't use it in our code  
09:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <vmassol> so if it's set to some other values then it would be in third party app but I doubt any would do that  
09:20 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, I'm asking because it "seems" the session timeout is way more than 30min on our setup but we have to do a real test  
09:20 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, and also this might be a lead to our issue with session stealing  
09:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning, could you try ssh-ing to xwiki.org? doesn't work for me this morning, it hangs  
09:23 <tmortagne> trying  
09:23 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, thanks for the check  
09:23 <vmassol> np  
09:23 <tmortagne> vmassol: not better here  
09:23 <vmassol> k  
09:23 <vmassol> reporting thanks  
09:24 <tmortagne> what's weird is that xwiki.org is ok  
09:24 <tmortagne> on http I mean, usually ssh is the last thing to go down :)  
09:24 <vmassol> yep  
09:25 <vmassol> myxwiki.org works  
09:26 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <Pbas> Hi (happy to have my irc passthrough firewall). anyways myxwiki.org display welcome page in ...2mn25.  
09:36 <tmortagne> Pbas: it's almost instant for me  
09:36 <Pbas> Ok thxs maybe it is our intenet access then.  
09:36 <martinus\_\_> instant for me too  
09:36 <tmortagne> or you just tried at the wrong moment :)  
09:37 <Pbas> no thxs to notice we have an horrible BW here ;-)  
09:38 <Pbas> and a naughty firewall too.  
09:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has quit  
09:45 <Pbas> Anyway do you know why $xwiki.getURLContent('https://set7z18fgf.execute-api.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/prod/?route=getClanDetails&clanTag=%23L9CGQYC')  doesn't work from myxwiki.org? It is json data and Vincent told me myxwiki.org return "error 500"  
09:45 <vmassol> ok, retsarting xwiki.org  
09:45 <abusenius> has quit  
09:48 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <vmassol> it's back  
09:53 \* Inge- blinks  
09:55 <vmassol> (that was me upgrading the antispam tool)  
09:55 <tmortagne> Pbas: I tried your URL on http://tuska.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/GetURLCOntent/ but I get empty result it seems, not an error  
09:56 <vmassol> I'm now going to enable registration again  
09:56 <vmassol> there'll be spam but I'll clean it and I'll use ti train the spam checker  
09:56 <vmassol> so if you see some spam just let me know and I'll handle it  
09:57 <vmassol> thanks :)  
09:57 <Pbas> It's strange because on my intranet local xwiki, I obtaine json data from this url  
09:59 <vmassol> cjd: right now it's pretty harsh  
09:59 <tmortagne> Pbas: I get the same issue locally with 6.4.6, what version is your intranet ?  
09:59 <tmortagne> note that in the cases I tested it looks like getURLContent bug since FF give me a content for this URL  
09:59 <tmortagne> ha I do get an error actuallt locally wait  
09:59 <Pbas> XWiki Enterprise 7.0.1  
10:00 <vmassol> cjd: if you use one of the keywords/regexes, it'll prevent saving the content + make your user inactive (which doesn't work btw) + register your ip as a spammer and next time you won't be able to save any content + log your disabled user ref in a page  
10:00 <tmortagne> something with SSL  
10:00 <vmassol> I'll tune it as we go...  
10:00 <tmortagne> "javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: Received fatal alert: handshake\_failure"  
10:00 <Pbas> but I think the problem is liinked at this url becasue I can retrieve other site  
10:00 <cjd> lol  
10:01 <tmortagne> what version of Java are you using on your intranet ?  
10:01 <tmortagne> I get this error with Java 8  
10:01 <vmassol> cjd: so when we add "keywords" they better be long strings and not just simple keywords as this will match too easily ;)  
10:02 <cjd> CIA, contras, cocaine, conspiracy  
10:02 <cjd> auto-ban all the tinfoil hatters  
10:02 <Pbas> I use java version "1.7.0\_65"  
10:02 <tmortagne> Pbas: myxwiki.org use java 8 too from what I see  
10:02 <vmassol> ok save works  
10:02 <tmortagne> so maybe it's a Java 7 vs Java 8 issue with something about this ssl certificate  
10:08 <tmortagne> Pbas: from what I understand from searching on Google the server is using a very old certificate and don't sent the right info so Java 8 just try the most recent version of SSL it knows which does not work with this server, Firefox tries all version until it get something and I guess Java 7 use an older version of SSL by default which work with this server  
10:11 <Pbas> Ok thxs. May be I can upgrade java version to test it if interested (if not i can cron a wget to retrive+upload json file)  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <Pbas> tmortagne: Maybe an incompatible SSL version? http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6353849/received-fatal-alert-handshake-failure-through-sslhandshakeexception  
10:30 <tmortagne> Pbas: yes this is what I suggested :)  
10:31 <tmortagne> looks like the client does not know what version of SSL to use so it's used the last one it knows which is not compatible  
10:31 <tmortagne> in such a case Firefox try all version of SSL one by one  
10:31 <Pbas> ok I will test java upgrade this week then  
10:31 <tmortagne> which is why it's working  
10:32 <tmortagne> same for all browsers probably, but Java is not trying any fancy thing like this  
11:08 <woshilapin> has quit  
11:10 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:13 <cjd> has quit  
13:14 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:26 <vmassol> restarting xwiki.org to try to fix an extension upgrade error  
13:26 <cjd> has quit  
13:29 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:06 <msmeria> has quit  
16:14 <vmassol> come on spammers, you're too slow!  
16:14 <vmassol> I need to test my tool!  
16:14 <vmassol> send us some spam please :)  
16:14 <cjd> just unban that IP which causes all of the problems  
16:15 <cjd> btw what are the words on your wordlist?  
16:15 <vmassol> ahah that's secret :)  
16:15 <cjd> heh  
16:15 <cjd> I was gonna see if the bot would get itself banned for logging them :)  
16:15 <vmassol> ah got some spam cool  
16:16 <vmassol> hmm shouldn't have been through  
16:16 <vmassol> I'll test manually  
16:17 <vmassol> haha good point  
16:17 <vmassol> I'll think about it  
16:18 <vmassol> that's the list cjd but please let me test first ;)  
16:18 <cjd> nps :)  
16:19 <vmassol> actually the bot shouldn't get banned  
16:19 <vmassol> because if it went through it means it wasn't caught  
16:19 <vmassol> and thus the bot won't be caught either  
16:20 <tmortagne> but if we write some keywork here it won't be saved by the IRC bot, right ?  
16:21 <vmassol> ah…. that's different :)  
16:21 <vmassol> indeed that should lead to the user used by the bot being caught as a spammer  
16:22 <tmortagne> antispam system disbaled XWiki user that try to save spam ?  
16:22 <tmortagne> \*disable  
16:23 <vmassol> hehe the irc logs are saved under the Vincent Massol user :)  
16:23 <cjd> I know :)  
16:23 <vmassol> (I guess that's because I'm the last one who started the bot)  
16:23 <cjd> Just because it's monday doesn't mean I can't troll  
16:23 <vmassol> :)  
16:24 <cjd> It would have been epic if you'd said the word and then triggered a chain of events which caused you to be banned from the wiki  
16:24 <vmassol> don't worry I've banned myself a lot of times locally when testing my tool  
16:24 <vmassol> it's easy to get unbanned  
16:24 <vmassol> first make a user inactive doesn't work  
16:24 <vmassol> \*making  
16:25 <vmassol> then you just need to remove yourself from the banned ip list which doesn't contain any spam keyword  
16:25 <vmassol> ok so that proves that I need a whitelist of spaces in which to not filter for spal  
16:25 <vmassol> \*spam  
16:26 <vmassol> right now I only have the AntiSpam space (hardcoded)  
16:26 <cjd> or a whitelist of users who are not affected?  
16:26 <vmassol> yeah I don't know which one is best, could need both  
16:26 <vmassol> I do need the space one for sure  
16:26 <vmassol> for the antispam files  
16:26 <cjd> maybe an xwql query to be sure to have everything ?  
16:26 <tmortagne> "first make a user inactive doesn't work" by default, it needs to be enabled in XWikiPreferences  
16:26 <vmassol> hmm unless you put all admins  
16:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: ah ok that's why, I'll retest locally  
16:27 <vmassol> not sure why it's not on by default  
16:27 <vmassol> (feeling of deja-vu)  
16:27 <tmortagne> there is a jira created by Edy about that to be it more visible i the admin and enable it by default  
16:27 <vmassol> k  
16:27 <tmortagne> there is even a proposal I think  
16:33 <vmassol> test  
16:34 <RalucaS> has quit  
17:05 <iphar`> has quit  
17:14 <vmassol> actually for the irc space we should check spam and prevent saving content with spam, just not ban the user under which the bot is running….  
17:17 <tmortagne> vmassol: not ban but still would be nice to see somewhere in the admin who has been cough saving spam  
17:17 <vmassol> I have that already  
17:17 <tmortagne> then it's enough IMO yes  
17:18 <tmortagne> for now at least  
17:18 <tmortagne> could be an option to ban disabled by default  
17:18 <vmassol> yes could be indeed  
17:18 <vmassol> since the IP is added to the ban list anyway  
17:18 <vmassol> it's not really required to ban the user  
17:21 <vmassol> hmm antispam doesn't work on xwiki.org, I guss I may need to restart the wiki once more  
17:21 <vmassol> doing that  
17:24 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:26 <vmassol> cool works now :)  
17:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: I needed a restart  
17:29 <cjd> That's not nice, you should say Users With Disabilities  
17:29 <vmassol> :)  
17:32 <vmassol> argh  
17:32 <vmassol> the ip that I ban is the cloudflare ip….  
17:32 <vmassol> that's what I get as the incoming ip  
17:33 <vmassol> checking if there's some other header I could use  
17:35 <vmassol> maybe the first ip in the X-Forwarded-For header  
17:35 <cjd> check the xwiki.cfg, I think there's a parameter about this  
17:36 <vmassol> cloudflare also adds "CF-Connecting-IP"  
17:36 <vmassol> about what?  
17:36 <cjd> X-Forwarded-For  
17:37 <vmassol> I don't understand what xwiki would do in xwiki.cfg  
17:37 <cjd> whether or not to consider that IP to be the originator  
17:37 <vmassol> I'm using httpservletrequest.getRemoteAddr()  
17:37 <vmassol> so it's independent of xwiki.cfg  
17:38 <cjd> check that it's not overridden by xwiki.cfg parameter...  
17:38 <cjd> clever method -> spot the header and change getRemoteAddr() to show the right one  
17:38 <cjd> but that must be able to be disabled  
17:39 <vmassol> yes, indeed, that would require configuration  
17:39 <vmassol> now anyone could fake such a header I guess  
17:40 <cjd> yeap :)  
17:40 <vmassol> I guess the CF one would be more accurate  
17:41 <vmassol> unless CF also updates the XFF one  
17:41 <cjd> Nah, if you are behind a proxy, XFF is accurate  
17:41 <vmassol> the problem is that the XFF one is a list  
17:41 <cjd> how long is the list ?  
17:41 <vmassol> so if the user has put a XFF header, I guess the proxy will only add to it  
17:42 <cjd> better lookup the spec but probably indeed it represents the proxy chain if there is one  
17:42 <vmassol> see http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA  
17:42 <vmassol> so I'd need to find the ip just before the CF one  
17:42 <vmassol> but that means knowing the CF one  
17:42 <vmassol> well I know their range  
17:42 <vmassol> still hard work...  
17:42 <vmassol> ah no  
17:43 <vmassol> I just need to take the last but one  
17:43 <cjd> nah  
17:43 <cjd> well yeah  
17:43 <cjd> either the first IP or the last  
17:43 <cjd> because you know you are behind 1 proxy (CF) you want to use the first IP in the list because everything beyond the first (CF) is something from the user  
17:43 <vmassol> the complex part is that this is different for each setup...  
17:43 <cjd> unless it's backward :)  
17:44 <cjd> check xwiki.cfg, there's something about this iirc  
17:44 <vmassol> there's nothing  
17:44 <vmassol> couldn't find it at least  
17:44 <cjd> hmm  
17:44 <vmassol> and doesn't ring a bell  
17:47 <vmassol> "where the value is a comma+space separated list of IP addresses, the left-most being the original client" so it's indeed the last but one  
17:48 <cjd> cool  
17:48 <vmassol> that's in the case of CF though  
17:48 <vmassol> (i.e. xwiki.org)  
18:08 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:15 <vmassol> cjd: you're right: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/7b073b9145ed62425abd7768b43c60cce347dc57/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/XWikiServletRequest.java#L333-L333 and https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/f1ff5d11cb4d42f9f9ae7b7b696e8f7c4b916d20/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/user/impl/xwiki/MyPersistentLoginManager.java#L675-L675  
18:15 <vmassol> but the implmentations are all plain wrong  
18:21 <cjd> :)  
18:22 <vmassol> crappy impl work...  
18:22 <vmassol> whoever did this didn't check the spec
